alert.note: Alert for St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 09 at 7:19PM CDT until June 09 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern St. Helena Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 719 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greensburg and Easleyville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
